communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records associated with coordination or interaction regarding -
The Declassification Engine, The History Lab
Matthew Connelly, Columbia University
Address: 403 Fayerweather Hall
Phone: (212) 854-4563
Contact: mjc96@columbia.edu

Please advise of "unusual circumstances" regarding changes to the status of this request.

NOTE: I request clarification and continuation of interest queries via this same channel of communication. Delivering physical mail to long deprecated and no longer used addresses does not fulfill the legal obligations of United States FOI code 5 U.S.C. § 552.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Martin Peck

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records associated with coordination or interaction regarding -
The Declassification Engine, The History Lab
Matthew Connelly, Columbia University
Address: 403 Fayerweather Hall
Phone: (212) 854-4563
Contact: mjc96@columbia.edu

Please advise of "unusual circumstances" regarding changes to the status of this request.

NOTE: I request clarification and continuation of interest queries via this same channel of communication. Delivering physical mail to long deprecated and no longer used addresses does not fulfill the legal obligations of United States FOI code 5 U.S.C. § 552.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Martin Peck

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records associated with the legal processing of FOIA request NFP-49378, Subject: LIST OF TECHNICAL TRAINING ACTIVITIES UNDERTAKEN BY FBI EMPLOYEES IN OFFICIAL CAPACITY"

Please advise of "unusual circumstances" regarding changes to the status of this request.

NOTE: I request clarification and continuation of interest queries via this same channel of communication. Delivering physical mail to long deprecated and no longer used addresses does not fulfill the legal obligations of United States FOI code 5 U.S.C. § 552.

Please confirm receipt of this request.

Thank you!
- Martin Peck

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Martin Peck
